posts.post: Thank you for suggestions on my hair! I love the outcome. My confidence has been boosted significantly! Thank you!
posts.Post Summary: The self state in this post is centered around the writer's feeling confident. She shows self-care behavior by upgrading her looks. She likes the outcome and herself . She attributes the change in her confidence to advice given to her by others, viewing them as facilitating her autonomy needs by suggesting and teaching her what she should do with her hair. She acts in a relating way by expressing her gratitude.

A.highlighted_evidence: My confidence has been boosted significantly

B-O.highlighted_evidence: Thank you for suggestions on my hair

posts.post:
Getting harder and harder
Chronic illness and coping with it is getting hard. I am struggling. Feel worthless. Feel like I dont deserve love because I'm sick. What's the point of you cant have love? How do I break free from that. I feel other people with chronic illness deserve love. Why shouldnt I? I dont know how to cope. Getting closer to the dark thoughts and planning. I have attempted in the past a few times due to this issue too. I need help and I dont want to admit myself because the hospital here is going downhill and last time they refused to give me medication I needed and almost killed me and wouldnt give me it till my parents spoke up. I cant go somewhere where they wont even try to listen to the patients. Urs dangerous there for me and scary. I dont really know what I need. Maybe just to vent this. I just feel unworthy of life and love. And it's getting harder and harder to cope.
posts.Post Summary: The main self state in this post is centered around her expectation that her relatedness needs will not be met, and her cognition of herself as unlovable and worthless because of her chronic illness. This expectation leads her to feel very depressed and fills her with despair. She behaves in ways that harm her because she is not taking care of herself although she is in severe distress, feeling herself getting closer to self-harm behavior, because she views others (the hospital staff) as unhelpful. The second self state in this post is adaptive, and is comprised of her wish to feel loved, and feeling worthy of love although she is chronically ill.

C-S.highlighted_evidence: I feel other people with chronic illness deserve love. Why shouldnt I?

C-O.Category: (1) Perception of the other as related

D.highlighted_evidence: What's the point of you cant have love? How do I break free from that

A.highlighted_evidence: Getting closer to the dark thoughts and planning

B-S.highlighted_evidence: I dont want to admit myself

C-O.Category: (2) Perception of the other as detached or over attached
C-O.highlighted_evidence: last time they refused to give me medication I needed and almost killed me and wouldnt give me it

D.Category: (2) Expectation that relatedness needs will not be met
D.highlighted_evidence: Feel like I dont deserve love because I'm sick

posts.post:
Worse
I want to self harm. I want to sleep and never wake up. I want to go away. I dont want to feel this way anymore. I dont deserve anything or anyones love and kindness. I'm really sorry to anyone I have hurt with my not being understanding. I am really sorry.   I'll try to sleep this off.   I am truly sorry, please forgive me.
posts.Post Summary: The self state in this post is centered around the expectation she will harm herself. She is feeling very depressed and hopeless, views herself as unworthy of relatedness.

A.highlighted_evidence: I dont want to feel this way anymore

C-S.highlighted_evidence: I dont deserve anything or anyones love and kindness.

D.Category: (6) Expectation that competence needs will not be met
D.highlighted_evidence: I want to self harm. I want to sleep and never wake up

posts.post:
AITA for not watching tv every night with my mom?
[removed]

26 USA Someone who can help motivate me to exercise everyday and avoid binging.
I have a heart issue where I have low blood pressure (it does not rise with activity either) and high heart rate. I need to exercise everyday (light exercise like walking) in order to help build strength and energy levels. When i miss a day, it is hard for me to get out of bed the next day, so it's very important for my health.   I'm not overweight, but I do binge at night sometimes and would like someone who could be a support to help me avoid that. When I eat a lot of carbs/calories at a time, it makes my heart worse it feels like. I get more dizzy and a higher heart rate. So, I need to avoid that but sometimes my apathy with depression overcome me and I'm like "fuck it" and do it anyways. So someone to talk to in those times could help.   I usually start to binge around 10-11pm. If there is anyone who could assist me with motivation for my health, I would love that! We could encourage each other!
posts.Post Summary: The main self state in this post is centered around the writer's desire to care for herself and get better. She is seeking help from others and feels hopeful about getting better with the help of others, and behaves in ways that help promote her self-care. The other self state is a maladaptive one, where she feels depressed and that feeling leads her to behave in a harmful manner towards herself by binge eating. The feelings of depression make her feel hopeless expect she will not get better, leading to the self-harm behavior of binge eating.

A.highlighted_evidence: If there is anyone who could assist me with motivation for my health, I would love that!

B-S.highlighted_evidence: who can help motivate me to exercise everyday and avoid binging

B-O.highlighted_evidence: If there is anyone who could assist me with motivation for my health, I would love that! We could encourage each other!

D.highlighted_evidence: I need to exercise everyday (light exercise like walking) in order to help build strength and energy levels.

A.highlighted_evidence: my apathy with depression overcome me

B-S.highlighted_evidence: but I do binge at night sometimes

D.Category: (6) Expectation that competence needs will not be met
D.highlighted_evidence: So, I need to avoid that but sometimes my apathy with depression overcome me and I'm like "fuck it" and do it anyways

posts.post:
Lead me on, sext with me, nothing, come back, you're so shitty.
This person and I were close friends made here on reddit. All coooooool...  then he found out I'm gonna go on a date. Then he tells me he likes me a lot. THEN goes on a date with a girl. Second date with her, sleeps over. Texts me WHILE STILL WITH HER. Super shutty imo. Tells me THE NEXT DAY he loves and would "ideally want a long distance thing with me". Has another date with this girl. Said he was gonna tell her about me. Things are weird. Take a break talking. Talk again after a couple days then sext. NEXT DAY nothing from him. He says it brought up bad emotions from trauma. Cool fine. I respect that as I have PTSD. I need a break from him again cus yeah. Decide to be friends. Cool. He is absolutely cold and distant. Never initiates a convo. I do it all. Then we finally talk after I'm having a breakdown and want to die. Found out he is dating that girl now. I am done. I cant be friends after all that. Date who you want, but I cant handle that. Just WHY.
posts.Post Summary: The main self state in the post is adaptive. It's centered around the desire to feel related and be in a relationship. The writer behaves in ways that facilitate closeness because of this desire, and feels very emotionally hurt when it doesn't go as planned. The second self state is one where the writer feels angry and disgusted , and views the other as detached and disrespectful. She feels like she can't handle it as if she is not competent enough.

B-O.highlighted_evidence: I'm gonna go on a date.

A.highlighted_evidence: Lead me on, sext with me, nothing, come back, you're so shitty.

C-O.Category: (2) Perception of the other as detached or over attached
C-O.highlighted_evidence: He is absolutely cold and distant.

posts.post:
I'm mean to people I care about when I'm suicidal.
I kinds just realized I do this. I want them to not care about me cus my mind thinks they dont already, so I make it fit the narrative I have in my head. I cant stop. Even when I tell them I do it (I did this weekend). Its me preparing them to not care if I do kill myself.   Dont worry, I told my friends, my family is aware. I'm gonna see my therapist soon and try my best to be honest with her. Just something I noticed.
posts.Post Summary: The main self state in this post is centered around her self-harm behavior and suicide attempts. when she behaves this way and feel depressed, she wishes to distance others from her because she views them as detached. It makes her behave in a mean way towards others and distance others. The other self state is adaptive, and is centered around the desire to feel better. it makes her behave in ways that facilitate self-care by sharing her needs with others, and seek professional help.

B-S.highlighted_evidence: I'm gonna see my therapist soon

B-O.highlighted_evidence: I told my friends, my family is aware

D.highlighted_evidence: try my best to be honest with her

C-O.Category: (2) Perception of the other as detached or over attached
C-O.highlighted_evidence: cus my mind thinks they dont already

D.Category: (2) Expectation that relatedness needs will not be met
D.highlighted_evidence: want them to not care about me

timeline_summary: The self states in the timeline alternate between adaptive and maladaptive voices. The adaptive voice is compassionate with the self, is behaving toward others in a relatable way, feeling proud or hopeful, wishing to feel related and get better with the help of others. The maladaptive voice is expecting others not to care, is engaging in self-harm behaviors with high suicide risk, feeling depressed and hopeless and viewing the self as worthless. Sometimes the maladaptive self state is present by itself, but sometimes it is switching back and forth with the adaptive self state in one segment.
